diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Gastroparesis, headache, polycystic kidney disease, hypertension
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with 5 days of nausea/vomiting and intolerance to oral intake, along with a history of recurrent nausea and vomiting correlated with renal cyst enlargement and UTIs. Physical exam showed diffuse abdominal tenderness. The acute nature and clinical picture supported the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis, especially considering the patient's symptoms and prior interventions.
